dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4290 IH: To require the Attorney General to study whether an individual’s history of domestic violence can be used to determine the likelihood of such individual committing a mass shooting.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Quigley introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To require the Attorney General to study whether an individual’s history of domestic violence can be used to determine the likelihood of such individual committing a mass shooting.

section.header: Study on whether an individual’s history of domestic violence can be used to determine the likelihood of such individual committing a mass shooting
section.text: Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Attorney General of the United States shall complete a study and submit a report to the Congress on whether an individual’s history of domestic violence can be used to determine the likelihood of such individual committing a mass shooting.
